DataElement.preferredDefinition: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.:A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug._The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The list of types for Targeting assays

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.:A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.

Concepts.definition: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.
A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.

Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The list of types for Targeting assays

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:Cellular uptake of extracellular materials within membrane-limited vacuoles or microvesicles. Endosomes play a central role in endocytosis.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Cellular uptake of extracellular materials within membrane-limited vacuoles or microvesicles. Endosomes play a central role in endocytosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.

Concepts.definition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
